item.title: Schedule 1 April 7 Update Adds Pawn Shop & Boutique With an Eyebrow-Raising Name
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/schedule-1-april-7-update-adds-pawn-shop-boutique/

The promised Schedule 1 April 7 update has arrived. TVGS—the game’s solo developer—has added many new features, including handy new Pawn and Boutique shops as the game enters a new beta test.

Schedule 1 aptly has a lot of content logged in the roadmap diary. Developer TVGS has lots of ideas and ways to keep its cornucopia of kingpins coming back for more. It’s probably for the best as they fend off infringement claims from rival title Drug Dealer Simulator—although it’s reported there’s no lawsuit.

Either way, a new update has dropped. It expands on Schedule 1’s foundations and is only a snippet of what’s to come.

New Schedule 1 Adds New Buildings

Pawn Shop Interior and Functionality Added

There are already a fair few buildings in Schedule 1. But they won’t stop being built as a new Pawn Shop is open where: “You can now sell pretty much anything (excluding product) to Mick at the pawn shop.”

Your best weed needs to wait for customers, unfortunately. But anything else you can get your hands on is fair game. It’s a good way to make extra cash to spend on new items.

A Boujee Boutique Awaits

Also included in the April 7 Schedule 1 update is the new “Bleuballs Boutique.” I’m choosing my words carefully here, but if you’re old enough to play Schedule 1, there’s already a good chance you know the meaning behind the store’s name.

I’ll avoid this topic like the plague and say it’s another fab addition to the game. You can find expensive jewelry watches here, and it’s best that you make some money at the Pawn Shop or by maximizing your profits before buying anything!

All Schedule 1 April 7 Update Patch Notes

A Steam post on the Schedule 1 game page has every change and what to expect. The fuller list also mentions tons of smaller additions to the game and a few fixes.

Check out the complete Schedule 1 update list here:

Additions

  • Added Bleuballs Boutique interior and functionality.
  • Added Pawn Shop interior and functionality. You can now sell pretty much anything (excluding product) to Mick at the pawn shop.
  • Added wooden sign.
  • Added metal sign.
  • Added wall-mounted shelf.
  • Added safe.
  • Added antique wall lamp.
  • Added modern wall lamp.
  • Added grandfather clock.
  • Added Ol’ Man Jimmy’s.
  • Added Château La Peepee.
  • Added Brut du Gloop.
  • Added silver watch.
  • Added gold watch.
  • Added silver chain.
  • Added gold chain.
  • Added gold bar.

Tweaks/Improvements

  • Improved phrasing for customer recommendation dialogue.
  • Added some extra null checks and validity checks.

Bug fixes

  • Fixed delivery destination dropdown overflowing outside of phone screen.
  • Fixed player lists sometimes not clearing properly when exiting to menu.
  • Fixed non-host clients sometimes not receiving ‘on day pass’ and ‘on week pass’ events.

Outside of the Schedule 1 update news, we have other handy tidbits you must learn, including how to drop and discard items. There’s so much to this game, and we want to know what you think of it. Our Insider Gaming Forum is the place to be, so head down and discuss your experiences with the game.

item.title: Hades 2 Launching as Nintendo Switch 2 Console Exclusive
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/hades-2-launching-as-nintendo-switch-2-console-exclusive/

Hades 2 fans desperate for the game’s full launch can only pick it up on Nintendo Switch 2 at release. It’s currently locked in as a Switch 2 console exclusive for the time being, with a PlayStation and Xbox launch coming later.

The Switch 2 exclusives keep coming. We’re still reeling from the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct where the bombshell dropped that FromSoftware’s next game—The Duskbloods—is a Switch 2 exclusive. Now, Supergiant Games has revealed Hades 2’s full release is closing in, and its first port of call on console is the Nintendo Switch 2.

Again, it’s a timed exclusive, but this is still big for Hades 2 and Switch fans.

Hades 2 Coming to Nintendo Switch 2 Before PS5 and Xbox Series X|S

The Nintendo of America X channel posted a video on April 8 about Hades 2 and its journey. The media clip is an interesting developer walkthrough, and an insight into the much-hyped sequel and its progress.

What you don’t expect is a message toward the end of the video saying: “Hades 2 Launching first for consoles on Nintendo Switch 2. More information coming later this year.“

Hades 2 has been in Early Access on PC since 2024. Supergiant Games has been honing the roguelike sequel, tightening up the mechanics, and making sure it lives up to the expectations of its Game-of-the-Year-winning predecessor.

You’re going to have to wait a bit longer to see how powerful Melinoe is if you’re on PlayStation or Xbox Series X|S.

Are you surprised by this announcement? Is this a strong reason to invest in the pricey Nintendo Switch 2 console? Let us know with a comment, and take the conversation to the Insider Gaming Forum.
